results.description:
Friday, April 22nd - Earth Day…Call on Mayor de Blasio to Announce Bolder Climate Action!

<a>RSVP here</a>

On April 22nd, Mayor de Blasio is supposed to announce the updates to OneNYC, the city's plan for dealing with climate, environmental and economic equity issues. We would love to be wrong about this, but most likely those plans will not go far enough or move quickly enough. On this same day, more than 130 nations will send their representatives to the UN to sign the Paris Climate Agreement. But this agreement is not nearly enough to stop the global climate crisis! The signing at the UN will be important, but we know that it is barely a first step.


On April 22nd, the People's Climate Movement NY and allies will hold a press conference on the steps of City Hall.

We’ll call on the Mayor to make priority commitments to offshore wind, mandatory retrofitting of large buildings, moving all NYC owned buildings to 100% renewable energy and other specific action. 

There will also be a more theatrical expression of what the future holds if immediate action is not taken on climate change. 

<a>Join us at City Hall on Friday, April 22nd.</a>

** Plan to arrive by 2:45 in order to be in place by 3 pm.

** Bring signs and banner with the name of your organization. Remember: no wooden or metal sticks!

** Bring props that highlight renewable energy sources, and/or that dramatize the potential  consequences of unchecked climate change...like life-jackets for when the waters rise!
results.name: Call on Mayor de Blasio to take bolder climate action!

Update: Due to forecasted rain Friday night, we have decided NOT to chalk Liberty State, and to leaflet (with environmentally-focused literature) at Grove Street instead! 

Original event:

It's almost Earth Day! And we all know what that means...

It's time for some serious environmentalist activism! On Saturday the 23rd, the day after Earth Day, there will be a large festival at Liberty State Park. So, the day before, we're going to deliver a message that festival goers won't be able to miss!

Our "canvas" is the northern pathway of the park -- via which nearly everyone local walks to get to the festivities:


We'll be delivering at least 7 messages in chalk, corresponding to the 7 parts of this infographic:


Additionally, any ideas you may have for creatively spreading the message are welcome! (There's plenty of pavement.) Chalk is a uniquely visual medium, and graphics can really pack a punch:

Logistics:

We'll meet at the North West corner of the park, the corner nearest the Jersey Avenue footbridge. From there we'll be chalking in the direction of the water. We will be easy to find on that main pathway along the North edge of the park.

Since we have a lot of messages to get out, we'll start early, at 5pm. For those who can't make it till later, that's okay! Just come when you can, we'll be out until 7:30 or so.

We'll have plenty of chalk, and a plan, so you don't need to bring anything. Except a desire to create a better world!

See you there!
results.name: Earth Day Activism at Grove Street PATH

results.description:
As per the feedback from group members, This meetup is strictly for Intermediate/Advance Tennis players with rating of 3.0 and Above

This rating is based on United States Tennis Association Rating Recommendations. Please see below for rating definition:

http://www.usta.com/Play-Tennis/USTA-League/Information/1655_General_Characteristics_of_Various_NTRP_Playing_Levels/

Format:


We play doubles and/or singles games with an interesting format:


* Warm-up: We begin our game by warming up through knocking some balls. This also fill the waiting time nicely for others who for some reason are running behind. Suggested time is around 15-30 minutes, with 2 minutes for serves practice.
* Teaming/Pairing: Players can pick their partners for the day. Ladies get a chance to make their choices first. Attempt is made to have balanced teams to have a good engaging tennis game.
* Game
- We play 1 set and follow the standard rules of tennis.
- For first set "First-Ball-In (FBI)" so this ensures that at least you get your first serve in as courtesy by taking maximum 10 chances. It is only for the first set of the day. Subsequent sets start without any practice serves or first-ball-in.
- Sides are rotated on every odd number of games such as 1, 3, 5 etc.
- In case of 6-6, the set is settled through tie-break.
- The scores are to be spoken out loud by the server after every point, so that there is no confusion or conflict during or at the end of the game.
- If the court has counter to keep the set-score, it must be updated so that other players get to know the score to coordinate the switching smoothly.
* After Set:
- The winner pair stays together and they move "up" to play against the winners of next court. Move "up" means towards the higher ratings and move "down" means towards lower ratings.
- The loosing pair moves "down" and splits to form new team, hoping to find the winning combination.
- Ultimately there is one pair who stands out as the "Champs of the day" if no more challenger pair left. That is the official ending of the tennis day, though players can stay longer to play more among themselves.

* Social: Depending on the mood and liking of the group, we can go out to eat, drink, and chit-chat somewhere close-by after the game.

Miscellaneous other stuff:
- Please bring a can of new / practice balls to play on hard courts.
- Players get tips by other players if they are open to improve their games. There is a healthy friendly environment and nobody should feel offended.
results.name: Friday tennis meetup (Levels 3.0 and above)

results.description:
It's been a little while since we've visited this museum, and it's definitely past time we visit again. You get a wide experience here- from the traditional eastern religions and philosophies to a modern sense of spirtuality and perception, and also a perfect blend of the two together. That sound snooty enough for you? All that aside, they have beautiful collections here, both ancient and modern art. Plus they have a trendy lounge with food, drinks, and a DJ. And you know what else? It's free- Yep, free, every Friday night from 6-10pm. You can't beat that- get some culture, get some food, and maybe get some groovin' to the music. For an added bonus, there's a happy hour from 6-7pm, 2-for-1 drink specials. They even allow us into the downstairs gallery while still enjoying our drinks. I don't know about you, but art appreciation seems a little easier with a drink in your hand.

For those of you that won't be able to make it at 6pm, that's fine. The museum has a fairly simple layout and it shouldn't be too dificult to meet up when you get there.

So the plan is: arrive when you can, enjoy the happy hour if you get there before it ends, check out some really interesting art, and do all that while getting to know some good people. Sounds like a great plan to me.

A little about the Museum from their website: The Rubin Museum of Art is home to a comprehensive collection of art from the Himalayas and surrounding regions. The artistic heritage of this vast and culturally varied area of the world remains relatively obscure. Through changing exhibitions and an array of engaging public programs, the museum offers opportunities to explore the artistic legacy of the Himalayan region and to appreciate its place in the context of world cultures.

The museum's collection consists of paintings, sculptures, and textiles. Although works of art range in date over two millennia, most reflect major periods and schools of Himalayan art from the twelfth century onward.

The exhibitions are organized with particular care to assist viewers who are new to Himalayan art. Wall texts and interpretive panels supply aesthetic, social, and historical perspectives to both scholars and casual viewers. The Explore Art Galleries on the third and fifth floors (with a video alcove on the sixth floor) take the viewer behind the scenes, answering questions about why and for whom the art was made. Books, paintings, photographs, artifacts, and computer terminals accessing the museum's website and affiliated sites offer other examples of Himalayan and related art.
results.name: The Rubin Museum of Art

Our event this month will guide you though starting, running and expanding your business by the largest growth engine for entrepreneurs in Southern California.  Our methods have resulted in entrepreneurs having success rates of up to 10 times the local market and we will share with you specific ways to grow your business for success.  


Please register here - https://generalassemb.ly/education/how-to-start-scale-and-exit-your-business-successfully/new-york-city/23447 

A focus of the talk will be how to communicate your message effectively to investors and also growth hacking techniques to drive users.  Your speakers are some of the most requested coaches in the startup world.

Brian Mac Mahon - User Acquisition Coach

Brian has run companies in over 35 countries and after 4 businesses has set up Expert DOJO, which is an accelerator for small business globally.  Brian's focus is on implementing corporate mindset to startup for a higher success ratio and everyone leaves this session with real world actions to help your business grow.

Ryan Foland - Investment communication coach

Ryan is a communication coach in Expert DOJO as well as a big part of the Blackstone Accelerator and is a specialist in concept communication in the startup world.  Learn form Ryan his 313 teaching method to help your company explain your message 

After the talk join us for networking and connections to help take your business to the next level. Expert DOJO are the premier business growth advisors globally and will have some of our best experts in growth hacking, venture funding and scaling on hand to guide you through the maze of business success. Our events always have a pay it forward focus and our members always walk away with a different feeling than any other event. Join us now and take your business to the next level

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
Riverdance April 22nd and 23rd 2016 at NJ Performing Arts Center

Friday, April 22, 2016 or Saturday A pril 23rd 2016
6:00 PM

New Jersey Performing Arts Center
1 Center St, Newark, NJ (edit map)

We'll figure it out after people buy tickets


Who buys tickets a year in advance to see a show? ME! Riverdance will only be playing locally for their 20th Anniversary Concert at the NJ Performing Arts Center in Newark , easy to get to by Path Train or Amtrak to Newark Station. This is the only place Riverdance will be playing anywhere close to NY and I just bought my center orchestra tickets through Ticketmaster for both nights. I wanted to let the groups know because this could be a great meet up - tickets to the show, drinks or dinner before or after and seeing the greatest Irish dance troupe of all time.

 
Here is a link to the homepage with a Riverdance video on the side and of course you can find many performances on You Tube. http://www.ticketmaster.com/artist/778497/?dma_id=345&c=EML_TM_PA_More&wt.mc_id=EML_NTF397243_14[PA_MoreDate_778497 So if you are like me and know that this is something you don't want to miss, check the Ticketmaster website for tickets and go for it! Both evenings the performance is at 8PM and tickets range from $40-$70. I can't say it's a rush since it is a year away but as you know, the best seats go quickly and it would be great fun to buy tickets separately but meet as a group! All other suggestions welcome. We can make plans to meet etc as the time gets closer and we see how many people are coming. REMEMBER the show is both Friday and Saturday - I am going to both so you can decide to go to either one and let me and the group know

Robin - see you May 5th at Dempsey's!!!!!

Hey Robin, get the conversation started!
results.name: Riverdance April 22nd and 23rd 2016 at NJ Performing Arts Center

group.name: The Irish in New York Meetup Group

results.description:
So its earthday, yeah i know, the earth hasnt been so friendly to me either.  And every attempt i make to save the earth results in me being called a hoarder or a cheapskate.  regardless i think the earth is something worthy of celebrating, while its still here.  and maybe forgiveness will result, maybe.  

if you want to be a part of this "positivity"  please come by this meet up.

a guarantee parts of the earth will be present, and if you share my feelings about the earth, we can fantasize about the moon, mars, or our beds- not in the sleazy way, in that it is a couple of feet above the earth, just teasing it- as if!
results.how_to_find_us: you'll find us

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6:00 - Start. Stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
6:30 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
7:30 - Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Milk and Honey Cafe located at 1119 Newkirk Ave. The closest train station is Newkirk Plaza on the Q line. Walk 3 block down Newkirk Avenue until you reach Westminster Road. We are sitting at the center table.

SOME TIPS:

Laptops are welcome. Remember to charge your laptop ahead of time!

Please buy something to support this organic cafe. It would make the owner smile.

Come on time. If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.milkandhoneycafeny.com
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Brooklyn

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

The card keys for the bathrooms are available from the front desk.  As a courtesy, please check to see if anyone else in the group needs to use the keys before returning them to the front desk.
results.name: Friday evening gaming at Flushing

Friday, April 22, 2016

Start your weekend off with the Empire Steppers

Join us at the Social Butterfly in Brooklyn for some great after work dancing, great music and people.

They have a great menu to enjoy: Beef and turkey sliders, bbq, Thai and buffalo wings, chicken fingers, shrimp, chicken and waffles, shrimp and grits and more.  The average price of the dishes is $10 and there will be drink specials as well. Another venue has opened its doors to stepping; let's show our appreciation by supporting the bar to this free stepping event.

SEE YOU ON THE DANCE FLOOR!

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

results.description:
Let's get together and trade some Disney pins!! Some people come with just a lanyard full of pins other come with a stack of books full of pins.  Either way we welcome you to our group.  We are happy to answer any questions that you may have about pins and will try to guide all of the new traders in a direction of years of fun and trading.  We will meet from 6-9PM in the food court just outside of the elevators.  We hope to see you there.

 

We ask that you not bring food since we are in the mall food court.  Please plan on buying something such as a drink at the very least so that we are actually adding to the mall's profits.  We are using their space after all for free.

 

I appreciate your RSVP so I know who to look for or not.

 

You can email me at [masked] anytime for a faster response.

My wife and I don't always get to the pin meet due to our kids social lives.   Other people do go, but if you are coming for the first time I want to make sure that we are there to greet you and make you feel comfortable.

 

Please feel free to email me with any questions that you may have.

 

Thanks,

Steven

results.description:
For our Spring/Summer sessions, we shall revert back to 3 Teams.

• Teams will be 7 a-side, 6 outfield players, NO sub, and a goal keeper.

• We play for 8 minutes or 2 goals.

• Winner stays! 

• If the initial game between the first 2 teams ends in a tie, a coin toss will be used to determine which team stays on.

• In the event of a tie, the new or incoming team stays on.

• Be Social, use your time on the sideline to get to know your teammates better :))


• We play with Red Uptown Soccer practice bibs to differentiate the teams.  

Please signup ASAP and may the force be with you :)

Disclaimer: By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org
results.name: Breath To Happiness

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge
results.name: SPANISH CULTURE & CONVERSATION WORKSHOPS (BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATE)

results.description:
Join us the 3rd Friday of each month for networking and coding! 


Socializing starts at 6:30PM — Make new friends, find a study group or study partner, or just practice your people skills. :-) 

Xcoding — That's what it's all about, right? During a typical MeetUp people socialize, work on Stanford assignments, ask other members questions, ask for help with a bug, offer help to others, etc. There is no set agenda and no formal presentation. If you prefer to sit in a corner and code away, you can do that. If you want to walk around offering people a helping hand, you can do that too.

Just Getting Started? Follow these steps . . .

• Stanford CS193P Winter 2015 Class (Swift) — Developing iOS 8 Apps with Swift 

• Stanford CS193P Fall 2013 Class (Objective-C) — Developing iOS 7 Apps for iPhone and iPad 

• Get the homework assignments and lecture code from Stanford University

• Download Xcode from the Mac App Store

• Sign up for a free Developer Account (note: the free account doesn't allow you to install apps on your device, for that you'll need the $99/year account)
results.name: iOS Study Group, 4th Friday

results.description:
Steven Spielberg followed Jaws (1975), his first major box-office success, with this epic science fiction adventure about a disparate group of people who attempt to contact alien intelligence. Roy Neary (Richard Dreyfuss) is an electrical lineman who, while sent out on emergency repairs, witnesses an unidentified flying object, and even has a "sunburn" from its bright lights to prove it. Neary's wife and children are at first skeptical, then concerned, and eventually fearful, as Roy refuses to accept a "logical" explanation for what he saw and is prepared to give up his job, his home, and his family to pursue the "truth" about UFOs. Neary's obsession eventually puts him in contact with others who've had close encounters with alien spacecraft, including Jillian (Melinda Dillon), a single mother whose son disappeared during her UFO experience, and Claude Lacombe (celebrated French filmmaker François Truffaut), a French researcher who believes that we can use a musical language to communicate with alien visitors. Lacombe's theory is put to the test when a band of government researchers and underground UFO enthusiasts (including Neary) join for an exchange with alien visitors near Devil's Tower, Wyoming. In 1980, a "Special Edition" was released. While its primary selling point was the addition of scenes inside the alien spaceship, Spielberg claimed that he also cleaned up some choppy editing in the second act.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fxp32VHaYdE

results.description:
活动收取门票$5每人。到场并参与游戏的请准备$5现金，刷卡$6。请在入场时交付并登记姓名 （定期有特殊优惠)。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间4月22日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开2-3桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

报名请RSVP并将姓名，Email，电话私信(message)给Lisa Yu.

results.description:
Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-24658477169

This is one of our most popular Meetups... We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because this event often sells out! As an incentive to get your ticket early, we will be raising the ticket price every few days. The price will be as high as $49 by the event time.

* THIS IS A MULTI MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THIS EVENT IS BEING LISTED ON OVER 15 DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUPS. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL EVENT ATTENDEES.

"Mingle & Taste Wines From All Around The World!"
Join us for a festive Wine tasting and mingle with fellow upscale NYC professionals where you will get to taste a wide variety of wines in a fun, relaxed environment. There will be red and white wines for all around the world along with delicious cheeses. Detailed instructions on how the wine was made with each pour!. Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring a friend. Expect more than 25 people (mostly singles) to attend. This is not an age specific event. Anyone friendly and interested in mingling and tasting great wine may attend.

Also enjoy complimentary cheeses & crudités!

When: Friday, April 22nd: 6:30 - 8:30 PM (You can arrive as early as 6:20 to check-in)
Where: "Some Good Wine" (13 E 8th St, New York, NY - between 5th Ave and University Pl)

POST WINE TASTING MINGLE! After the wine tasting ends we will be inviting all attendees to stroll down the street to a nearby bar so we can continue to mingle. We will be announcing the venue where this will be held during the wine tasting event.

Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-24658477169

FAQ:

How many people will be attending? We usually have between 25 and 40 people at this event.

What us the dress code? The dress code is "neat, casual or trendy". Basically just don't wear gym attire. What you wear to work is likely perfect.

Can I come alone? Yes 75% attending typically come on their own... some people bring a friend or 2.

Is this event social? Yes! What makes this event great is that a lot of socializing goes on and the vibe is very laid back and friendly.

Do I need to know about wine? Absolutely not... Most come to learn and to socialize.

What is the age range? This is not for a specific age range. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang out and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this event will sell out so grab your ticket as early as possible.

Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-24658477169

We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because this event often sells out! As an incentive to get your ticket early, we will be raising the ticket price every few days. The price will be as high as $49 by the event time.
results.name: Wine Tasting Event - Wines, Cheese & Mingle! (Online PrePay Required)

results.description:
Our friends at North Brooklyn Runners are putting on a track meet at the McCarren Park track in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. This is the fifth year that they have hosted a meet.

NBR has been a tremendous supporter of Whippets track meets in the past, so let's return the support by coming out and showing them how it's done!

More information is here:

http://northbrooklynrunners.org/upcoming-races/trackmeet/


Kids races start at 6:30pm.  The open mile starts promptly at 7:00 (women's sections, then men's), followed by the Sprint Medley Relay and 4x400m Relay.

The track is at Union St and North 12th St, and is VERY EASY to get to:

Google Map Image

Directions from the L subway: take the L to Bedford Ave. (first stop in Brooklyn). Exit toward front of train (if coming from Manhattan) to Driggs & N. 7th. Walk north on Driggs (street numbers go up) to N. 12th, turn right and walk to Union. Track is at Union and North 12th.

Directions from the G subway: take the G to Metropolitan Ave/Lorimer St. Exit station on NORTH end of train. Get out of subway at Metropolitan and Union. Walk NORTH on Union (toward the BQE overpass) 7-8 blocks to N. 12th St. Track is at Union and North 12th.
results.name: NBR Track Meet (Williamsburg)

-Take a break and socialize around the appetizer table (cheese, crackers, veggies, etc)

-Following the wine tasting some of the group may keep the festivities going at a local tavern for more food and drink.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
The Banff Mountain Film Festival is an international film competition featuring the world's best footage on mountain subjects. The festival began in 1976 and is held annually on the first weekend in November in Banff, Alberta, Canada. Each year, the festival receives approximately 330 films in the film festival competition. An international film festival jury chooses the best films from the finalists and awards prizes in eight categories: Grand Prize, Climbing, Mountain Sports, Mountain Environment, Mountain Culture, Short Mountain Film, and Feature-Length Mountain Film. Audience members select the winner of the People's Choice Award.

The Banff Mountain Film Festival returns to Princeton University for its 20th year. Join the Princeton students, staff faculty, and local community for this campus favorite that combines awe-inspiring films and an intermission gear raffle (Princeton students run prizes to lucky winners)! The spectacular action-packed films feature rock climbing, mountaineering, kayaking, mountain biking, extreme skiing and explorations of the natural world.

Tickets are available now and the show always sells out, so buy your tickets early.

https://outdooraction.princeton.edu/events/films-speakers

Purchase tickets online $18:
https://tickets.princeton.edu/Online/

Films for Friday Night:
• Builder
• Climbing Ice: The Iceland Trifecta
• Nature RX
• Operation Moffat
• Paddle for the North
• Paradise Waits
• Salween Spring

results.description:
Magic The Gathering: FNM

Are you looking for a way to play while meeting new friends and winning cool foil prize cards? Then Friday Night Magic is exactly what you're looking for! Try it out at HobbyTown and discover why Friday night is the best night of the week!

Every Friday* HobbyTown hosts a Friday Night Magic draft.

*Note: In months with five Fridays, the 4th Friday will be Two-Headed Giant sealed instead of Draft.

For Booster Draft Format

You don't need to bring anything with you to play. Basic lands are provided. Sleeves are recommended, but not required.

Registration starts at 6:45 PM and the event starts at 7PM. The entry fee is $15. Two prize packs will be added to the prize pool for each participant.

The tournament structure will be swiss with three rounds. Matches will be best of three.

Promo cards will be awarded to the top two finishers in each draft pod. Any remaining promo cards will be awarded randomly to players not in the top 2.

Promos are given to the Top 2 finishers in each pod, then any remaining promos are given out randomly to other participants.

For all the store events and for more, please visit our Facebook page:

facebook.com/HobbyTownNanuet

Looking forward to seeing you at FNM!

results.description:
"If we all lose hope there is no hope. Without hope, people fall into apathy. There's still a lot left worth fighting for."

- Jane Goodall


Do you want to learn how we can make a differencing healing the planet? The earth cannot heal without our help. 

Spend Earth Day with us watching the movie, Racing Extinction. Artists and activists expose issues of endangered species and mass extinction. This film will shed light on the seriousness of our choices but also leave us with hope to make a difference. Let's watch, learn, and hopefully ACT! 

See the trailer here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MwxyrLUdcss

Donation of $10.00 is suggested (or whatever you can afford). All proceeds will go to Conservation International: http://www.conservation.org/Pages/default.aspx

results.description:
In ECK we live an active life.  We may not know what tomorrow will bring, but it doesn't matter; we try to do the best we can today with the spiritual insight that we have gained through the Spiritual Exercises of ECK.


- Harold Klemp, ECK Wisdom on Inner Guidance p. 35


 Join us for our worship service on Is Life a Random Walk?  Share with us your perspective and understanding in the discussion that is part of our worship service.

The ECK Worship Service is an opportunity to gather with other beings interested in experiencing divine love, the light and sound of God, and exploring our relationship with Spirit.  In the service we will hear a reading from the writings of Harold Klemp, the Spiritual Leader of Eckankar on the day's topic, have the opportunity to do a spiritual exercise, chanting HU, an ancient name for God,  and  then  discuss openly in small groups the topic of the service.

We look forward to having you join us.
results.how_to_find_us: Take the elevator to the 5th floor and walk to the other side of the building.
results.name: Is Life a Random Walk? -  ECK Worship Service

group.name: Past Lives, Dreams, Soul Travel throughout New York

results.description:
Tonight's session focuses on improving our Sketchbook work. 

All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.
results.how_to_find_us: Please ask the doorman for the location.
results.name: Friday Night - Instructed Drawing Session

results.description:
Ujamaathon is a hackathon weekend where we work collaboratively on ideas to improve our communities. This is NOT just for the traditional computer hacker, but for the business and creative hackers who want use their talents to help grow underserved communities. 

Whether you’re a seasoned entrepreneur, or have never been involved in a startup environment before, this weekend welcomes all those who love their community enough to bring their ideas to fruition. 

We will explore the power of bringing together software, the power of the crowd (crowdfunding and crowdsourcing), and exponential technologies to scale projects that will make a lasting impact in our communities. 

By building a community of problem solvers, we'll forge a legion of doers who empower communities through technology, creativity and collaboration. 

SEE YOU THERE!

Friday April 22, 2016

6pm - 7pm Panel Discussion "Raising Capital in the Future"

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions

Over and over and over. We are on auto pilot now, so we will have this, or another event, at a place to be determined, (TBD), every two weeks, with a pancake or some other panic event tossed in to keep everyone aggravated to the fullest.

As usual, if you RSVP 'yes' but can't make it, call or text me; your merry group organizer, Greg, at[masked] 1066.(we don't want to worry about you all night)


And the standard 'It's -OK- to decide to come at the last minute, without an RSVP, or late, or bring well behaved young ones' is in effect as well.  no need to call, just show up. the tables aren't nailed down and another can always be added.


Veggie Heaven is open till 11pm, and sometimes later(we loose track of time, someone keeps ordering scallion pancakes, and the staff is slow to tie up the evening's loose ends, so we are usually there for a good spell, I think 1:30AM is our record). Thus, lateness due to scheduling issues, etc, is no biggie. 

If we have a change of venue, for any given week, we will let you know in advance.

results.description:
Introducing Brazilian Medium & Psychic Surgeon John of God on Video

John of God is said to be a medium and psychic surgeon. He is based in Abadiânia, Brazil, where he runs the Casa de Dom Inácio de Loyola, a spiritual healing center where he sees thousands of visitors every week from all over the world.

John of God claims to act as a vehicle for God's healing, and to have absolutely no recollection of anything during the procedures. He states:

"I do not cure anybody. God heals, and in his infinite goodness permits the Entities to heal and console my brothers. I am merely an instrument in God's divine hands".

Millions of people have consulted with John since 1965.[citation needed] Up to 3,000 people per day stand and wait in line to see him individually.[citation needed] He encourages research into his healing abilities in the hope that medical science can make use of his success in the treatment of humankind.[citation needed] At the Casa de Dom Inácio, where treatments take place, John invites medical doctors to come onto the stage to observe his work.[citation needed] He also regularly prescribes meditation and walks to a nearby waterfall as part of treatment. The Casa also sells herbs, blessed items and artefacts such as magic triangles. It was estimated by 60 Minutes Australia in 2014 that these sales earn John over $10 million per year.[9]

When called for a spiritual surgery by John, patients are offered the choice of 'visible' or 'invisible' operations. If they select an 'invisible' operation (or are younger than 18 or older than 52) they are directed to sit in a room and meditate. John also claims that spiritual physicians can perform surgery on the actual patient via a surrogate when the actual patient is unable to make the trip.[10]

A very small percentage of people choose a 'visible' operation where John operates without traditional anesthetic. Instead he says he uses "energized" mineral water and the spiritual energies present, the latter which are provided by groups of volunteers who meditate in a separate room called the 'current room'. These practices such as inserting scissors or forceps deep into a nose and scraping an eye without an anesthetic or antiseptics have been scrutinized by medical authorities and skeptical investigators.

John tells people not to stop taking their medicine and says not everyone he serves will be cured. Often the treatment includes capsules containing pure passion flower that are claimed to carry special blessed spiritual energy to support the individual's healing process. Science says that this is the placebo effect[13] John has undergone trials and scrutiny of his work. He has been arrested several times for practicing medicine without a licence and has been jailed once.

John of God will be appearing at Omega Institute in Rhinebeck, NY, in September.

Program begins at 7:30PM.

Facilitator is Dr. Jay Kantor, http://drjaykantor.com .
results.name: Introducing Brazilian Medium & Psychic Surgeon John of God on Video W/ J. Kantor

group.name: North Jersey Body, Mind, Spirit Meetup

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center in Bayside, Queens. We convene in the Community Room.
results.name: Friday Night Boardgaming in Bayside Queens!

John of God will be appearing at Omega Institute in Rhinebeck, NY, in September.

Program begins at 7:30PM.

Facilitator is Dr. Jay Kantor, http://drjaykantor.com .

results.description:
1916 - The Irish Rebellion - landmark documentary screening

written, directed and produced by the Keough-Naughton School of Irish Studies at Notre Dame University. Narrated by Liam Neeson.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CN2dimzxzp8

Easter Week in 1916, a small group of 2,000 Irish rebels began an uprising against the British forces, consisting of 20,000 men. Although many knew they could not succeed they felt the weight of destiny— the moment to strike for independence had come. After a week of fighting, many of the rebels were executed.

But The Easter Rising reverberated around the world in freedom struggles from Ireland to India.

This landmark documentary tells the dramatic story of the events that took place in Dublin during Easter Week 1916. Featuring a combination of rarely seen archival footage, new segments filmed on location worldwide, and interviews with leading international experts. The film uncovers the untold story of the central role Irish Americans played in the lead up to the Rebellion.


Plus a short film, specially commissioned by the Irish Film Board to commemorate 1916

My Life for Ireland by Suitable Films

Mary Hendriksen, Assistant Director of the Keough-Naughton Institute for Irish Studies at the University of Notre Dame will be present at the screening to highlight the significance of the 1916 project, its scope, and the research that went into making the film possible.


Information on the companion book to the PBS series

Students, Seniors, Unemployed $8

Click the link below to purchase a ticket to this event:


http://www.bigmaven.com/experience/after-hours-murder-mystery-garden-reception/

Join New York Adventure Club for a murder mystery experience at the historic Mount Vernon Hotel Museum, once a country escape for New Yorkers living in the crowded city at the southern tip of Manhattan during the 19th century.

In this fictional mystery game, loosely based on an historic newspaper account, an unidentified skeleton has been discovered at the Mount Vernon Hotel.

Who was killed? By whom? With what? Explore the Museum by candlelight and collect clues to unravel the mystery and solve the case. Collaborate with others or go it alone, and find out how quickly you can uncover the truth. The clues and story from our last visit will be different this time around.

Afterwards, we’ll have a wine reception in the Museum’s private garden!

Click here to see pictures from our last Murder Mystery event at MVHM!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: Murder Mystery & Reception @ Mount Vernon Hotel Museum

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
https://youtu.be/HdW5GRjusWc

If you're a Floetry fan like myself then I'm sure that you're just as hyped as I am that they've partnered up again to give us a great night of music with all of their unforgettable (and sometimes underrated) hits!

We'll be meeting up to see them in concert on Friday April 22 at 8pm. The tickets are sold HERE at Ticketmaster starting at $65 for General Admission seating. Booths start at $100.

The General Admission seats are FIRST COME, FIRST SERVE so to ensure that we get good seats I plan to arrive at 6pm and be seated at 6:20 - 6:30ish (To give people time to arrive since only entire parties can be seated.)  

I can't guarantee tables or that we will all sit together if we arrive at different times but either way if you're in the building you're in for a good show!)

My plan is to eat and have a few drinks before the set starts at 8pm since there is a $10 food and/or drink minimum. 

If you have ANY questions let me know and don't forget to check out the blog at

<a>www.thesingleoneinthegroup.com.</a>


FAQs according to the B.B. Kings website:

Q. Seating?
A. Seating for our concerts are on a first come first served basis; the earlier you are here, the better seats you can get. Sorry, but we cannot seat incomplete parties. Some performances are only partially or even non-seated, so please arrive early and call our box office for additional information. All of our seating is cabaret style; you may be seated at a table with other guests. There is a $10 per person Food & Beverage minimum.

Q. Food & Drinks?
A. We are a full-scale restaurant. Our menu is American Continental with a Southern flair. We also have a full bar with all premier liquors and domestic and international cold beer. You can have the option of eating in Lucille's Grill, or you can even eat while watching a show. We serve a full menu at all of our concerts. Our menu is available on-line at www.bbkingblues.com/menus.shtml

Q. Is the show really sold out?
A. Most of the time, tickets become available on the night of the show even if it has been sold out. We release those tickets as and if they become available.

Q. Parking?
B.B. King's Parking at Meyers Parking Garage
146 West 44th St ~ Between 6th & 7th Ave.
(Additional Entrance on 43rd St)
Exclusive Deal for B.B. King Blues Club Customers
Price: $25 for customers attending shows only.
Have ticket stub validated at our Box Office or by your server.
Parking Coupon
View the Garage

Q. Age Limit?
A. B.B. King's Blues Club & Grill is open to all ages. Some late night shows are 21+, please check show page for details.

Q. Dress Code?
A. There is no dress code for either B.B. King's Blues Club & Grill nor for Lucille's Bar & Grill, though we do not encourage shorts.

Q. Handicap Facilities?
A. We are fully handicapped accessible.

Accessible by all major Subway/Train lines: A,E,C,1,2,3,7,N,Q,R,S,W,B,D.

Located near Port Authority, Grand Central, & Penn Stations.

By Car:

FROM WESTCHESTER, CONNECTICUT, THE BRONX:
1) Henry Hudson Parkway South (becomes the West Side Highway in Manhattan) to 42nd Street. Take 42nd Street east to the B.B. KING BLUES CLUB AND GRILL, between 7th and 8th Avenues.
2) FDR Drive South to 34th Street. Take 34th Street west to 8th Avenue. Turn right on 8th Avenue and continue to 42nd Street. Turn right on 42nd Street.

FROM NEW JERSEY:
1) The Lincoln Tunnel: Follow the tunnel exit to 10th Avenue. Turn right on 10th Avenue and follow (heading uptown) until you hit 42nd Street. Turn right onto 42nd Street and continue to B.B. KING BLUES CLUB & GRILL between 7th and 8th Avenues.
2) George Washington Bridge: take the Henry Hudson Parkway South (becomes the West Side Highway) to 42nd Street. Take 42nd Street east until you see B.B. KING BLUES CLUB AND GRILL between 7th and 8th Avenues.

FROM QUEENS AND LONG ISLAND:
Take the 59th Street Bridge. Exit the bridge and make a left onto 2nd Avenue. Take 2nd Avenue downtown to 42nd Street. Make a right onto 42nd Street and continue west, across town, until you see B.B. KING BLUES CLUB AND GRILL between 7th and 8th Avenues.

FROM BROOKLYN:
1) The Brooklyn, Manhattan or Williamsburg Bridge: Take the FDR Drive North to 34th Street. Take 34th Street west until you hit 8th Avenue and continue until you hit 42nd Street. Turn right onto 42nd Street. B.B. KING BLUES CLUB AND GRILL is between 7th and 8th Avenues.
2) The Brooklyn Battery Tunnel: take the West Side Highway North to 42nd Street. Take 42nd Street east until you see B.B. KING BLUES CLUB AND GRILL between 7th and 8th Avenues.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON Games @ Brooklyn

Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet @ La Fama. We are here every Friday For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class, after admission is also on. Admission: $10.00 to get in. Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by the instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details, join the facebook group and/or join the Class meetup group. Links below:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.
results.name: Salsa Dancing: La Fama Mention Salsa New York for the discount !

results.description:
The Tuesdays' Level 1 Salsa class is officially closed to new students but there there are ways to join. You are are eligible to take the class if:

1) you attended at least 1 of the first 3 classes

2) You never attended but you know how to do the basic-step and the right-turn.

3) You come to the La Fama Salsa social (info below) this Friday and take the review class at 9:30pm.

La Fama is a small cozy dance social. A social is an event that is about dancing with everyone. People are friendly and very social so come alone or bring your friends and family. This takes place in a boutique studio with professional sound system and a DJ that will play salsa and some bachata. There will be a review class for anyone and everyone to take if they choose. I will be teaching the basic step, the right-turn, and basic partnerwork. Come practice, catch up, and dance. Let's do it!! :)

Admission: $10

Time: The class starts at 9:30pm and the dancing starts at 10:30pm

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.
results.name: La Fama Salsa Social + Class

results.description:
We’re taking the Quiet Clubbing adventure off to Hudson Terrace, which will be an incredible spot to throw down the way that only we do! This venue is right across the street from the absolutely massive parties that we used to throw at Pacha before it closed it’s doors and you better believe that this will be just as big as the way we used to throw down right across the street! Look out for major excitement, lot’s of dancing and tons of surprises. This is going to be a wonderful night!

3 DJ’s Spinning Live!
DJ 1 (Green): Top 40 hits, Dance, Pop
DJ 2 (Red): The best of 80’s & 90’s, and 2K music!
DJ 3 (Blue): Hip-Hop, R&B

What the night includes:
VIP Bottle Specials (LEARN MORE)
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

WHAT YOU NEED
You MUST have a credit or debit card for the check-in process, nothing will get held or charged on site to your card. If the headphones are NOT returned, there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card after the event.

HOW IT WORKS
When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ’s with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what channel you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off to talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave!
results.name: Quiet Clubbing Party @ Hudson Terrace!

Friends,

Come and join us at this Friday, April 22 @ Skyroom rooftop. We had a blast this past weekend. It's going to be a fun-filled evening.

Skyroom is conveniently located near Times Square, and many subway stations. 

This is a multi- Meetup group event, so you will get the opportunity to meet other members from my Meetup groups.

Do get there early so that I will be able to introduce you to the other invitees. Coming early also prevents you from the long lines.

Gents free before midnight. Ladies free before 1am.

Skyroom is definitely one of the top 5 rooftops in the city, and the Friday night party there is a lot of fun! Feel free to invite your friends to this event. 

Please note that the venue has a retractable roof so event will happen rain or shine.


Looking forward in meeting many of you!

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer

Rory

results.description:
Let's tour Koreatown in Manhattan! Visit the shops, eat lunch (barbecue?), sample the pastry, buy soju, maybe karaoke?


Koreatown is a tiny slice of New York where Korean culture is dominant and Korean-owned businesses are booming. The heart of the small neighborhood is Korea Way, the strip of W. 32nd Street between Broadway and Fifth Avenue. It's very close to Madison Square Gardens and Penn Station. This is an old article from Business Insider, but it includes slides and great information http://www.businessinsider.com/koreatown-new-york-2011-11#


And let's eat dinner at a restaurant I've had the pleasure to experience in the past Franchia. The stone bowl was so good. Affordable and delicious.

Depends on which motorcoach is used. Have to collect money early due to tickets selling fast and for  bus deposits. Payment plan: Deposit of $50.00 due by October 15th.,2015                        2nd deposit of $50.00 due by November 15th,2015, 3rd deposit due by December 15th,2015                        Final payment is due by January 15th ,2016  Send Checks to Charleen Breckenridge, 9109 Amber Oaks Way, Owings Mills,Maryland,21117You may use PayPal as well, using my e-mail address,[masked] Send by picking Friends And Family. Phone #[masked] Cell #[masked]

In May 1921, the new musical Shuffle Along became the unlikeliest of hits, significantly altering the face of the Broadway musical as well as that of New York City. By the time Shuffle Along stumbled into town after a back-breaking pre-Broadway tour, it was deeply in debt and set to open at a remote Broadway house on West 63rd Street. In a season full of spectacles, such as Sally - a Ziegfeld musical - and another edition of George White’s Scandals, Shuffle Along’s failure was almost a foregone conclusion. New York City was still in the throes of the Depression of 1920. And despite being celebrated vaudeville performers, Miller and Lyles and Sissle and Blake had never performed on Broadway, much less written a musical. But with an infectious jazz score and exuberant dancing, Shuffle Along ignited not just Broadway but all of New York City. George Gershwin, Fanny Brice, Al Jolson, Langston Hughes, and famed critic George Jean Nathan were among the many fans who repeatedly flocked to West 63rd Street to see a cast which - during its run of 504 performances - featured such incipient luminaries as Josephine Baker, Paul Robeson, Florence Mills, Fredi Washington, and Adelaide Hall. Because of Shuffle Along, Uptown and Downtown met and became one.

results.description:
Hey everyone!

In collaboration with the National Organization for Women, MPofNYC will stand up against protesters trying to intimidate women from accessing health care outside of women’s health clinics in NYC. Volunteers will help escort women into clinics and give them pro-choice support. NOW-NYC will provide on-the-ground training and the support to help women and families access clinics safely. We will be escorting as a group on Saturday morning, April 23rd.  

Anyone interested in participating MUST ATTEND the training call on March 23rd at 12:30pm with the NOW-NYC representative, details posted under "Clinic Escorting Training Call" event. It should be no more than 30 minutes and we will have the opportunity to ask questions. If you can not make the call, please message the group and we will coordinate another time for you. See more at: 


http://nownyc.org/actions/protect-our-local-abortion-clinics/#sthash.hENQzVpt.dpuf

http://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/31/nyregion/new-yorks-abortion-protest-law-is-praised-by-justices-but-few-others.html?_r=0 ;


Looking forward to this! Please do not hesitate to ask any questions!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it).
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.) Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances. We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation: We'll play rain or shine. We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.description:
For this Healthy Neighborhoods Mobile Market volunteer effort in Harlem, please register through the City Harvest website at the link below (your RSVP will be added in the HarlemGo Meetup manually after doing so).


https://cityharvestvolunteers.civicore.com/index.php?section=indGpRegistrations&action=profile_conditional&fwID=5052


The Registration process is as follows:


• Follow the Group Sign-up Link above and click "New User" to create a new volunteer profile and click "Submit" (repeat or previously registered volunteers can simply log in)

• Read project details and click "Register" to confirm participation

• You will then receive a confirmation email and a reminder the day before the project


Only 10 volunteers are needed. All volunteers must be 18 years and older.

Description of Duties:

Volunteers will be stationed at 3-4 market tables, each supplied with thousands of pounds of fresh produce that they will help distribute to eligible market-goers. Sample produce items may include bananas, onions, cabbage, or potatoes. As the market-goers stop by each table, volunteers greet them-and then weigh and bag the produce. Note: All food is distributed free of charge and the volunteer effort WILL BE indoors in the event of cold temperatures / bad weather.


That's it for now. If you have any questions, feel free to give me (Daniel) a call or text at [masked]. Thanks!

About City Harvest Healthy Neighborhoods Program


Nearly 1.4 million New Yorkers are facing hunger and for many people that City Harvest serves, healthy food is unavailable and unaffordable. In turn, diseases related to poor nutrition – including diabetes and heart disease – tend to be concentrated where demand for emergency food is greatest.

As a natural extension of the anti-hunger work we began more than 30 years ago, City Harvest developed Healthy Neighborhoods programs to respond to the need for emergency food, improve access to fruits and vegetables for residents in low-income communities and provide nutrition education that will inspire affordable, healthy meal choices. Through our Healthy Neighborhoods programs, City Harvest partners with residents, community organizations, after school programs, and local businesses. Together we work to achieve a long-term impact in the fight against hunger by engaging residents in healthy choices and enhancing the local food landscape. Building off our nutrition education classes which began in 2000, and our Mobile Markets which began in 2004, City Harvest has since expanded Healthy Neighborhoods programs to high-need communities across the five boroughs.
