results.description:
Bonjour !


Le printemps est la ! Let's enjoy spring together through beautiful Riverdale ;

Starting with marble Hill, a very peculiar neighborhood which used to be a bump on the northern tip of Manhattan but it is now attached to the Bronx (the local area code is 718 -Bronx-) but residents still vote in Manhattan. The name comes from the Inwood marble that starts cropping there...

From here, we will walk along the scenic « Palisade avenue » towards Wave Hill and we will encounter many beautiful houses and mansions protected by an ancien forest, facing the Hudson.

The high of the walk will be in Wave Hill, which used to be the former residence of Mark Twain and now is a botanical garden overlooking the Hudson River.

Superbe !

Riverdale covers about three square miles in area. It has one of the highest elevation in New York City, affording it views of the Empire State bd, George Washington Bridge, Hudson River and New Jersey Palisades.

NOTICE THAT :

-Bring water, sun protection (maybe?), and comfortable walking shoes.

-The Wave Hill admission fee is $8 Adults, $4 Students and Seniors 65+

-This walk is about 7 miles and moderate paced. You don't have to walk on the Palisade avenue to Wave Hill, you can leave from 231st if you want after visiting Marble Hill.

-The meeting time is (before lunch) at 1:00 PM.

DIRECTIONS ?

Public Transportation by Metro-North:  Take the No. 1 subway train to Marble Hill/225th Street.

For the way back, we will get a one way Metro-North train ticket from Riverdale to several other stations, including Grand Central Terminal, 125th Street in Harlem. If you take the train to Grand Central Terminal, the fare will be higher than taking the train to Yankee Stadium or 125th Street in Harlem for instance. The fare depends on the zone. ..

We can try to buy a ticket at the Marble Hill station's vending machine before starting the walk. That will save us time. And purchasing a regular fare ticket on board the train is considerably more expensive.

-IMPORTANT : Before the walk, there are few places where you can have access to restrooms. There are NO restrooms available on the Palisade avenue. Later on, restrooms will be available at Wave Hill.

-If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, just please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Merci !

-If you arrive late, no worries. Just text me and I will send you a 'dropped pin' through Google maps/my gps location service :

My phone number is[masked]/[masked]

A bientôt !Alex
results.name: Riverdale : Marble Hill to Wave Hill

results.description:
Hola! We will be reading the Spanish newspaper and discussing the news- in Spanish! This is great for beginners to advanced speakers! Make sure to purchase a coffee or bite to eat before we start.

-Spanish reading practice
-Spanish Pronunciation practice & correction
-Spanish conversation & debate after

This is great for anyone looking to start learning Spanish so you can expose yourself to the sounds of the language. Reading is the easiest, it is read just as it is written, unlike English. It will be $5 to join this event.

I will bring copies of the actual newspaper for the day. please only RSVP if you are serious about attending so I know how many copies to bring. Also, please make sure to purchase something to eat or drink at this venue.
results.name: Cafe y Las Noticias: SPANISH Newspaper Reading, Pronunciation Practice!

results.description:
I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at Think Coffee to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person if more than 3 people come to the class and $15/person if 1 to 3 people come to the class.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: Spanish conversation Advanced. $10/person if more 3people or $15/p if less

results.description:
The Hike Is a Sierra Club Event!

6  - 7-mile walk through Crocheron Park and over the Cross Island Parkway, down the Brooklyn-Queens Greenway, past Bayside Marina, through Fort Totten and back.

Bring some water, Bananas or Granola Bars. Bug Repellant and Sunblock.

Please Don't Forget the Positive MOOD

AND YOUR CAMERA

Duration approx 3+ hours,  approx 6-7 + miles

===>>>  IMPORTANT... WHERE TO MEET

We'll meet IN THE PARKING LOT of Crocheron Park !!! There might be signs to take you to the other side of the park. Please ensure you come to the PARKING LOT!

Use this link for Google maps or put this address into your GPS:

[masked]th Place, Bayside, Queens, NY 11361

===>>>  AFTER-PARTY!!!

After the Hike, you are welcome to optionally join us for some well deserved Food / Drinks at Tony Romas.

Happy Hour Menu and Drink Specials. 

Freshly Prepared - Served Hot - Homemade Chips.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

This practice is about water polo. Emphasis is on playing and learning the game by playing. Some of us have been playing since childhood. Others have picked it up as adults. We're friendly and inclusive, but we play hard.

Requirements:

-You have to join New York Recreation. $75 for 6 months for access to all rec centers and pools in the city. If you're under 25, you pay $25 for 1 year. http://www.nycgovparks.org/programs/recreation-centers/membership

-Beginners are welcome, but you must be a good swimmer.

-You MUST bring a lock for a gym locker.

-You should bring an athletic bathing suit, goggles, and a towel. Bring a swim cap if you have long hair.

results.description:
Healing art and movement workshop to connect body, mind, and spirit through creativity. 4 hour workshop Process:
*We will begin with meditating & aromatherapy to focus on an intention, attracting what you deeply need or desire.
*Through painting and collage on paper or canvas, each person will freely create art.
*Embodying the intention through group therapeutic movemeny/dance, putting our desires into action on a physical level.
*We end the day with group discussion, sharing of our artwork, and aromatherapy. *This workshop is for adults: The process is ideal for any person (no art or dance experience necessary) who wants to reconnect with his/her true self or life path, reduce stress, and integrate creativity into his/her life.

**We need a minimum of 5 participants to hold this workshop. Cost must be paid in advance and all art materials are included to take home. :)
Cost: Preregistration required via link on our website:
http://www.thrivemovementtherapy.com/schedule/2016/4/12/8k86488j2as911suckl1egnkfsftjn

$60 for this 4 hour workshop led by Registered Dance/Movement Therapist and artist, Jennifer Giuglianotti.
results.name: Embodied Art Healing Workshop

results.description:
Inline skate lesson for Beginner to intermediate skaters.
My friends and fellow skaters!

Welcome to the 2016 Skating Season!!!

Skate School by Central Park Skate Patrol is welcoming you to the first skating class of the season!

Cost of this class is: $25 per individual class, $45 for 2 classes or $60 for package of 3 classes; discount packages should be paid in full; fees are collected before class begins, however we suggest that you to pay in advance, using Pay Pal option.

Please note that you must have complete set of protection gear and helmet to participate in class. Currently there is no rental, so you need to purchase all items.

We meet Just inside the West 72nd Street Entrance to Central Park at 11:00AM, The class leaves for the lesson area by 11:10AM.  We will then walk to the practice area so we are geared up ready to skate by 11:30AM.

Reminder – wrist guards, helmets, knee and elbow pads are required to participate in class. These items have to be purchased in advance. Please check all of your gear before coming to class to see if it fits properly. Make sure the wheels, buckles, straps, snaps, laces and everything else is in good working order.

Please note that if it is raining or the lesson surface is wet, we will NOT have the class. Cancelation of class will be posted in advance.
If you have any other questions, please post them on this page or text/call me at [masked]

This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

results.description:
(Taken from the official website www.hbcuspringcoming.com.)

What if we told you that you didn't have to wait until Fall to experience the love and fellowship of an HBCU Homecoming? 

What if we told you that for the 2nd year in a row, New York City will host a special Spring Homecoming for graduates of HBCUs?


That is exactly what's happening this April, in New York City, as the entire HBCUnion celebrates SpringComing's return! That's right, we are throwing a Homecoming….in the Spring…for ALL HBCU'S!! Nearly 1,000 attendees have already begun preparations for SpringComing's return (April 22th-24th) and are gearing up for a weekend full of reliving unforgettable moments, making priceless memories and reconnecting with long lost friends!

Last year, graduates from all over the nation, draped in school colors, poured their school pride all over New York City in a weekend full of events designed to feel like being back on the yard! Filled with opportunities to both party and network, this weekend, slated to draw a national audience of influencers from cities across the country, should not be missed!

This is The Yard. This is your campus. This is the quad. This is SpringComing Saturday, or as we call it:School Daze. Wait, let's put it in terms that will resonate.

This is TAILGATE, minus the football game in the background. Trust us, between the surprise performances, grilling stations and sponsored tents you won't even realize there wasn't a halftime show.

*Bring a blanket to sit on, some cash to buy food at the grilling stations and come draped in your HBCU attire!
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be arriving at the park at 2:30 pm! I'll have on a red HBCU Grad tshirt and long curly/ wavy hair!
results.name: HBCU Springcoming 2016: School Daze on the Yard!

Workshop Outline

results.description:
Bring your haskell projects! Want to give a lightning talk? Contact Chris G. to sign up --->

---

New to Haskell? That's ok! We're also organizing an optional workshop for beginners. More details will be announced when it's available.


Workshop will cover building a basic web app with Haskell that reads api data and displays in the browser (ReflexFRP). An example of a similar type of app is available [1], note for that example you'll need an API key from nasa [2]. We'll work on something similar but with a different API.


Instructor: Ali Abrar, co-founder of Obsidian Systems.

---

Thanks to PositionDev for hosting us! All attendees must abide by the Code of Conduct guidelines. 

---

Come chat with us in our new slack team! Over 30 haskellers have already joined our team, chatting about the latest tools and news in the haskell world and the projects they're working on. To join our team visit our Slack invite page and we'll send you an invitation!

You are invited to join the next meetup.Our meditation meetups are conducted by Dhammakaya meditation instructors, and practitioners who have committed their lives by ordaining to teach meditation and Dhamma(reality of life). They are eager to teach their technique and wisdom on meditation methods, benefits and knowledge gained from meditation, and our true purpose. Every session will be inspiring and will help encourage one to meditate. We hope to see you

results.description:
At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


Session 1 (Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay by Debit or Credit using Venmo to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 3pm. ST BART'S SWIMMING POOL

• 3/19/16; 3/26/16 (No Lesson); 4/2/16; 4/9/16; 4/16/16; 4/23/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. (Session 2 will progress members)

In 4 short months we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315 (Call for more details)
results.name: I won't drown Swim Challenge - Sold out

group.name: ! Black People Who Love The Outdoors and Adventure NY

results.description:
***Go to Bigcityvolleyball.com To Sign Up ***


From 3:00pm-6:00pm and 6:00pm-9:00pm

**An RSVP on meetup.com will not reserve your spot**


Tired of waiting on long lines or showing up 3 hours early to a gym just to try and get a spot. Well wait no more!

Sign-Up in advance to participate in Big City Volleyball's weekly Open Play on Saturday afternoons and evenings from 3pm – 9pm at The High School For Environmental Studies (444 West 56th Street betw. 9th & 10th Avenue), one of our premier gyms with two courts, conveniently located just a few blocks from Columbus Circle.

                                                -->Click Here To Sign Up!<-- 

Who Can Participate:
Intermediate to Advanced players only! Players must be able to handle a free ball, pass accurately, serve consistently and play bump-set-spike vball rather than just retuning the ball to the other side of the court. (In Big City that's Divisions 3, 4 & 5). If you cannot do the above, you will be asked to leave. You don't have to currently play in the league to participate.

Where:
High School For Environmental Studies (444 West 56th Street - between 9th & 10th Avenue)

When:
Saturdays Sept thru June

Times:
Early Session 3pm -6pm
Late Session 6pm - 9pm

How Much:
$15 per session On-line in advance 

(ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS)

Only players who register on-line will be guaranteed a spot.

Players who pay at the door will not be given a spot to play until all on-line registered players have been checked in and then only if space permits.
Players who pay in advance will lose their spot if they arrive after check-in is complete.
Players can register in advance as many people as they like per session.
Players can Register in advance for as many sessions as they like.
*Must be 21 years old to participate.
*Only 24 spots per session.
(ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS)

How It Works
Each court will have up to three teams of 8 players. games will be to 21 points rally scoring. Players will sub in on dead balls. If a team wins two games in a row they must sit one game.

Big City prides itself on friendly competition. Please play fair and maintain respectable behavior towards your teammates and opponents. Call your own violations! (Nets, Sets and Out Balls). If you are rude in any manner or raise your voice you will be asked to leave and not allowed to participate again.


Click Here To Sign Up

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
For our second meetup, we will attend Mass at the "mother church of New York": Old St. Peter's.

This is New York's oldest Catholic parish, dating to 1785, shortly after the British army evacuated New York at the end of the Revolutionary War and Catholic worship was allowed in the newly free America. The current Greek Revival church building was built in 1836.

The parish also opened the first Catholic school in the US in 1800. It was home to famous early parishioners like St. Elizabeth Ann Seton, who converted to Catholicism here in 1805, and the Venerable Pierre Toussaint, a former slave who became a great 19th-century philanthropist. The French Holy Cross fathers who founded the University of Notre Dame celebrated Mass here the day after they arrived in the US in 1841, on their way to South Bend, Indiana.

The Venerable Father Felix Varela was a priest here in the early 1800s. Mother Adelaide O'Sullivan of St. Theresa, a Carmelite missionary, was baptized here. Not all the parishioners were saints. Old West outlaw Billy the Kid (Henry McCarty) was baptized here as well.

More recently, the late Father Mychal Judge was laid before the altar of St. Peter's by firefighters who recovered his body from the World Trade Center on 9/11. The church itself suffered minor damage from the terrorist attacks when part of the landing gear from one of the planes hit its roof.

St. Peter's is renowned for its works of art, including Jose Vallejo's The Crucifixion, which remains above the main altar ever since it was gifted to the church by the Archbishop of Mexico City in 1789.

Mass at 4 p.m., feel free to arrive early to explore (the church is open 24/7) during the Year of Mercy). Meet up after Mass around the corner at Lilly O'Brien's, 18 Murray St. for drinks, food and fellowship.

See you there!
results.name: Mass at St. Peter's, social at Lilly O'Brien's

Let's explore the Met together every other Saturday with as little pressure as possible.

Go in the 81st entrance (not up the big stairs), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. We'll be at the set of benches (#8) in the middle on the left inside the room. At 4:15pm we will split up.

We'll decide who will go see what with whom, wander galleries, and meet at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30pm for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

Everyone is responsible for their own admission and tab. I recommend you bring cash for your tab to make settling the check easier.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at the set of benches (#8) in the middle on the left inside the Center For Education room, which is straight ahead when you get past coat check. At 4:15pm we will split up. Then meet up at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30.

Bachata Class-


This is a fun, Level 1 class that begins with the fundamental basics of Bachata dancing!

The class warm-up will focus on footwork, turns, body movement and proper technique. We will work on proper frame and connection in order to build comfort with leading and following, all while learning a fun dance pattern for you to use on your next romantic night out!

No experience is needed, and no partner is necessary! 

Participation fee: $15 per person or $50 for 4-week session 

This is a weekly class that is regularly attended, the attendance shown for this event does not reflect the full attendance of the class, space is limited - Please RSVP if you would like to join us! 

Also, please feel free to contact us for information about receiving your first trial class for FREE! 

You can find more information about our classes and events by visiting our Web-site, Spirare Dance Studio.

You can also find us on Facebook, Spirare Dance.

results.description:
Hello everyone!

We are using this meetup as an opportunity for new members to get introduced to our wonderful Meetup group.  We encourage both men and women to play!  In order to play, you will need to have attended our Meetup no more than 15 times.  To check, go to your profile and look under "Has Attended" (see pic below).  If you have more than 15, do not sign up please!  Your RSVP will be removed and the organizers will give you the stink eye the next time they see you.

We look forward to seeing new faces on the court!

Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. 

Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! 

Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2016 as we're not a litigious group. 

If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds.  

6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. 

Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.


*****NEW*****

Share your Spotify playlists and tracks with us and we'll play them during gametime!

Send an email to [masked]

And please submit good tunes otherwise we'll be Basketball for the Musically Challenged...

results.description:
Join a bunch of beautiful singles as we casually stroll along the entire length of the High Line while the sun sets. This is usually a VERY popular event. See the photos from one of last years' walks. 

The High Line is an elevated rail line transformed into a public park that spans 24 blocks on Manhattan’s West Side. 

Afterwards, we'll have a few drinks and chit chat on the Frying Pan. The Frying Pan is a salvaged historic boat turned into a giant floating restaurant and bar. Cool right?! 

We'll meet at 5 PM on the corner of Ganesvoort and Washington streets under the start of the High Line and we'll get to know each other while we wait for everyone to arrive. 

The walk will start at EXACTLY 5:30 PM.  If you are late, you will miss us. Do not be late. The group will not wait.

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing under the start of the High Line and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. 

When you come to a Date Walking event you will take a casual stroll with anywhere from 10 to 25 wo/men over the course of about an hour. It's a really fun and relaxed way to meet someone special or multiple possibilities face-to-face. 

Closest Subway: A, C, E and L to 14th Street

Pace: The pace of this walk will be super casual.

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­
results.name: Singles Sunset Walk on the High Line + Drinks on the Frying Pan

results.description:
You Go to My Head
by Carole Boston Weatherford

I sang my songs so much
that they became
the soundtrack for my dreams,
the melody of my moods,
a room I lived in,
and a balm for my wounds.
I sang my songs enough
to know them backward
and forward, enough
to wonder if they could lift me
from hometown haunts
to center stage.
I’d sung my songs enough
to think I could take on
Baltimore’s best talent
at the Harlem Theatre
Amateur Hour
and maybe even win.
If you sing a song enough,
it can go to your head that way. 

-- --

Great poetry has rhythm. Maybe there's a cadence, a refrain, or a hook that keeps a poem together. And maybe a great poem isn't so much unlike a striking pop song. 

Try writing a poem that's like a song, or write a song and read it like a poem, or any combination of the two. 

We'll have some time to write and read our songs poems together next Saturday. Looking forward to it.

results.name: Your Poems Like Your Songs They Go to My Head

results.description:
This event is for backpacking newbies who already have gear or for anyone else who wants to join and have  a fun night of camping at Harriman State Park.

For those of you interested in trying out tarp camping for the first time, this is a great trip for you!   I recommend an 8x10 nylon tarp, 12 stakes, and about 50 feet of paracord.   Trekking poles are a plus, but you can also use sticks or trees to support your tarp.  I suggest a ground sheet (a poncho works great) and a good sleeping pad with a high R value (5+).  

I have a limited amount of gear to lend out for camping:

-1 x Small 46 liter backpack (Gossamer Gear Gorilla)

-1 x Medium 46 liter backpack (Gossamer Gear Gorilla)

-1 x Large 65 liter backpack (Gregory Z 65)

-1 x 8x10 Nylon Tarp and tackle kit

-1 x Tarptent Notch (single person 27 ounce backpacking tent.)

-1 x Tarptent Rainshadow 2 (2.5 pound 3 person backpacking tent.)

Please private message me if you're interested.

Participants are encouraged to bring equipment that they have questions about, but shouldn't feel like they need to go out and purchase gear.  Our objective is to see and try out gear in the field before you make expensive investments. 

This is the second part in a series of Intro to Backpacking events which will hopefully culminate in a section hike along the Appalachian Trail.


Suggested Reading:

Ray Jardin's "Trail Life"

Ryan Jordan's "Lightweight Backpacking & Camping"

Andrew Skurka's "The Ultimate Hiker's Gear Guide"

Section Hiker's Backpacking Blog

CampingJay


Hike Description:

Distance: ~7 Miles

Hiking Time: This is an overnight event

Attractions: Two scenic lakes, panoramic views, Bald Rocks, stars!

Highest Elevation: 1,380

Elevation Gain: ~2,500 feet

Parking Coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Map: NYNJTC Harriman Bear Mountain Trails - Map #118 & 199

Route Description:

Long Path (Aqua) to Dunning (Yellow) to Ramapo-Dunderberg (Red) to Bald Rocks Shelter. Then, Ramapo-Dunderberg (Red) to Long Path (Aqua) to Dunning (Yellow) to Arden Surebridge (Red Triangle)

Recommended Day Hiking Gear:

The 10 Essentials

All participants must be prepared with their own minimum equipment for backpacking.  You must either bring your own gear or plan ahead to share with someone.  Although we will be camping at a shelter site with a privy, please do not plan on having access to these facilities. BE PREPARED.

• Warm Clothing and Rain Gear

• Sleeping Bag rated to 30 Degrees or Cooler

• Tent, Tarp or Ultralight Shelter

• 2-3 Liters of Water

• Water Filter or Purification System

• 2 Days worth of food (about 6000 calories)

• Bear Bag or Bear Canister

• Lightweight Stove (if you plan to cook)

• Map and Compass

CampingJay's Gear List
NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty-five years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in courts throughout the country, with his office in Long Island, and his concentration in securities and derivative litigation.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
I've led you guys on amazing daytime adventures all over the tri-state area but it is my hikes that turn us into creatures of the night that you seem to enjoy the most. Why in the world would you want to hike in the dark? With your vision reduced your other senses become hyper aware and you'll experience the forest in a whole new way. You'll be able to smell and hear that bear about to eat you rather than just see him!

We're going to have a nocturnal adventure at Harriman State Park, one of my favorite local playgrounds. Starting at the Reeves Visitor Center trailheads in the Southern section of the park, we'll trek through the forest along the Seven Hills trail, follow a bubbling brook for a bit, then trek through the forest and ascend to a westward-facing  rocky plateau overlooking the Hudson Valley. Here we will stop for a while and enjoy what should be a beautiful sunset.


After the sun goes down, we'll trek a bit further and descend the mountainside to our next destination, Pine Meadow Lake. We'll hang out lakeside for a bit under the full moon, enjoying the stars and serenity of night, and if the mood strikes -- and we can find dry wood -- we'll make a campfire to toast some marshmallows and other fireside goodies.


A little heads up, if you are afraid of things that go bump in the night then you might want to sit this hike out.

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your organizer is in the running for hardest working person on meetup. While everyone else is running in the other direction, I'll be the first one to jump in front of that bear when he tries to eat you.

The Important Stuff ...

• This is going to be an INTERMEDIATE hike of about 8 miles and expect to be in the forest until about midnight. You don't need to be a world-class athlete to participate, but you need to be in decent physical shape.


• This is a social hike, the pace will be moderate. If you yearn to channel your inner Mountain Goat and feel the need to race everyone to the top of the mountain, this is not the hiking trip for you.

• Dress in layers of non-cotton clothing -- remember it is chillier at night, wear hiking boots or trail shoes (I wouldn't recommend sneakers but that is at your discretion), a hat, bring 2-3 liters of fluid, a packed dinner and/or snacks, and insect repellent. Also pack a pocket poncho in case of showers.


• Bring a headlamp and spare batteries. You may want to bring an additional handheld flashlight as well.

• Heavy rain cancels the hike.

• I will distribute my mobile phone number to the confirmed RSVPs.

How To Get There ... Carpool!

There is no mass transit option for this hike so drivers are needed.

Take NJ Route 17 north to the New York State Thruway and take the first exit, Exit 15A (Sloatsburg). Turn left at the bottom of the ramp onto N.Y. Route 17 north, and continue through the Village of Sloatsburg. Just past the village, turn right at the traffic light, following the sign for Harriman State Park. Cross an overpass over railroad tracks and continue along the Seven Lakes Drive, passing under the Thruway overpass, and soon entering Harriman State Park. Proceed for another mile to the Reeves Meadow Visitor Center, on the right side of the road. Park in the Visitor Center's parking lot (SEE PHOTO BELOW). If the lot is full, parking is allowed in certain roadside areas.

Please post if you are driving and can pick up passengers (how many and from where). If you need a ride, please be proactive and contact a driver directly. Passengers, as a courtesy you should chip in for gas, tolls, and coffee for the driver.
results.name: Not So Urban Athletics: Sunset and Full Moon Night Hike in Harriman State Park

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: SpeedMeeting-  Singles Ages 27-39 - 2f/2m spots left

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: SpeedMeeting - Singles Ages 27-39 - 1m/3f spots left

results.description:
Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

results.description:
Dear group members,

We hope everyone is enjoying the beginning of Springtime. After more than two years of successful programing, ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’ will close its doors in June :(. But before the curtain comes down ;) I am happy to announce that we will have three great concerts to farewell our series with a big smile. The first of these concerts will be on Saturday APRIL 23, 6PM - 7-30PM at Cornelia Street Cafe with a performance by myself :) The Rebeca Vallejo Trio (George Dulin- piano and David Silliman- percussion/drums) will be showcasing our unique mixture of Jazz, Flamenco, Brazilian music and body percussion ;)
I want to thank you all for supporting this music series during the last couple of years and I hope to see you all there!!!


APRIL 23, 6PM - 7:30PM
$10 Cover + $10 Minimum
29 Cornelia Street, Greenwich Village, NY 10014

For reservations call Cornelia St Café IN ADVANCE at[masked] 19. When making reservations ask to speak with Jonathan. Because the venue is small and it gets really hectic, in order to help the venue's stuff be able to sit you all together, I suggest the group meets right outside the venue (or by the bar area) at 5:30 pm... It is not always guaranteed you will be able to sit in the same tables but I can guarantee you will always meet great people at these concerts and will enjoy great music :)

‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’ is a series of jazz flamenco concerts that showcases the work of musicians whose artistic vision, although strongly based in Jazz sounds and approaches, latches onto the roots of Flamenco.

The fusion of Flamenco with the flavors of the old and new continents not only preserves this genre, but also helps to take it further into the future.
results.name: ‘The Flame’ returns for its last season with a performance by Rebeca Vallejo

Open Mike

results.description:
I've led you guys on amazing daytime adventures all over the tri-state area but it is my hikes that turn us into creatures of the night that you seem to enjoy the most. Why in the world would you want to hike in the dark? With your vision reduced your other senses become hyper aware and you'll experience the forest in a whole new way. You'll be able to smell and hear that bear about to eat you rather than just see him!

We're going to have a nocturnal adventure at Harriman State Park, one of my favorite local playgrounds. Starting at the Reeves Visitor Center trailheads in the Southern section of the park, we'll trek through the forest along the Seven Hills trail, follow a bubbling brook for a bit, then trek through the forest and ascend to a westward-facing  rocky plateau overlooking the Hudson Valley. Here we will stop for a while and enjoy what should be a beautiful sunset.

After the sun goes down, we'll trek a bit further and descend the mountainside to our next destination, Pine Meadow Lake. We'll hang out lakeside for a bit under the full moon, enjoying the stars and serenity of night, and if the mood strikes -- and we can find dry wood -- we'll make a campfire to toast some marshmallows and other fireside goodies.

A little heads up, if you are afraid of things that go bump in the night then you might want to sit this hike out.

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your organizer is in the running for hardest working person on meetup. While everyone else is running in the other direction, I'll be the first one to jump in front of that bear when he tries to eat you.

The Important Stuff ...

• This is going to be an INTERMEDIATE hike of about 8 miles and expect to be in the forest until about midnight. You don't need to be a world-class athlete to participate, but you need to be in decent physical shape.

• This is a social hike, the pace will be moderate. If you yearn to channel your inner Mountain Goat and feel the need to race everyone to the top of the mountain, this is not the hiking trip for you.

• Dress in layers of non-cotton clothing -- remember it is chillier at night, wear hiking boots or trail shoes (I wouldn't recommend sneakers but that is at your discretion), a hat, bring 2-3 liters of fluid, a packed dinner and/or snacks, and insect repellent. Also pack a pocket poncho in case of showers.

• Bring a headlamp and spare batteries. You may want to bring an additional handheld flashlight as well.

• Heavy rain cancels the hike.

• I will distribute my mobile phone number to the confirmed RSVPs.

How To Get There ... Carpool!

There is no mass transit option for this hike so drivers are needed.

Take NJ Route 17 north to the New York State Thruway and take the first exit, Exit 15A (Sloatsburg). Turn left at the bottom of the ramp onto N.Y. Route 17 north, and continue through the Village of Sloatsburg. Just past the village, turn right at the traffic light, following the sign for Harriman State Park. Cross an overpass over railroad tracks and continue along the Seven Lakes Drive, passing under the Thruway overpass, and soon entering Harriman State Park. Proceed for another mile to the Reeves Meadow Visitor Center, on the right side of the road. Park in the Visitor Center's parking lot (SEE PHOTO BELOW). If the lot is full, parking is allowed in certain roadside areas.

Please post if you are driving and can pick up passengers (how many and from where). If you need a ride, please be proactive and contact a driver directly. Passengers, as a courtesy you should chip in for gas, tolls, and coffee for the driver.
results.name: Not So Urban Athletics: Sunset and Full Moon Night Hike in Harriman State Park

What is qabalah? What is the Tree of Life? What techniques can I learn from qabalah to help me in my day-to-day life?

Join us as we discuss an essay from Jim Eshelman's book Peals of Wisdom on "The 32 Paths Of Wisdom", a key text of qabala. Continuing from our last meeting, we'll go in-depth on the correspondences and images embodied in the Tree of Life. We'll also discuss basic techniques for using these symbols in meditation and personal ritual.

This lecture is part of a series of talks drawn from the book Pearls Of Wisdom. It will be possible to participate in the discussion without having read the book, and there will be copies of the book available for purchase at the discussion. ($30.00)


We ask $8.00 donation for room rental.

results.description:
We've finalized permission to shoot in Woodlawn Cemetery up in the Bronx, one of the darker locations available via the subways.  This is a great location with a huge amount of opportunities for light painting or using the full moon to capture the monuments under more natural light.  We'll have at least two of the mausoleums opened for our use.

We'll meet up there at the main gate off Jerome Avenue at 6:30 and be let in and sign waivers.  I'll then host a quick discussion and demo of light painting for those who are interested and that will leave about 45 minutes to wander around prior to sunset and get acquainted with the area before it gets too dark.  I'll do another quick demo when it gets dark enough, around 8 or so and be around the rest of the evening via phone if you have any questions.  We'll have to start packing up and heading back to the main gate around 10:30 to ensure that we are out by 11:00 and they don't have to come find us.

Due to the fact that they'll be staying open late for us and hiring a security guard to make sure nobody gets hurt there will be a charge for this meetup.  There is also going to be a limit of 20 to the group for the same reason.  I am willing to offer full refunds up to midnight on the 18th to try to ensure that those who are unable to come can free up a spot for someone who can.

I hope you can make it, this is a great location and I'm very happy to be able to open this space up and teach some techniques that you might not be familiar with.  Let me know if there are any questions and I'll see you on the 23rd!

HERE'S WHAT YOU SHOULD BRING:

 - Your camera.  This will need to have manual settings, we'll be asking more of your camera than the onboard brain will be comfortable advising you on.

 - A tripod.  You'll need a stable shooting platform and a tripod provides the most flexible way to go about it, especially when you need to step away from your camera to light a monument.

 - A flashlight, preferably two.  I like to bring a dimmer walking around light and one to actually use to lightpaint, but bring what you have.  You can also bring what you think would be fun, glowsticks, spinning lights, blinking LED things you found on Canal Street, whatever you think might be interesting on camera.  An off-camera flash is also a great option as well if you want to shoot any people.  Have a look at this post about how non-conventional lighting can be what you're looking for.


 - A camera remote.  This will let you get more than 30 seconds of exposure from your camera.  Vital for those four minute exposures by moonlight or the two minute exposures to let you light your subject.

 - Snacks.  Four hours is a long time to be out in the evening, so bring along something to sustain yourself.  We will have access to the restrooms in the main building but no way to run out and get a granola bar.


Questions?  Please let me know, either in an email or in the conversation bit below, I'm here to help!
results.name: Woodlawn Cemetery

results.description:
Unfortunately there's no episode this week but that doesn't mean we can't get together and watch something! For this movie night I've decided to screen my favorite movie of all time: 2001: A Space Odyssey.
We will be in room 612

     2001 was written by Arthur C Clarke and Stanley Kubric. Production of the film started in 1964 when the two got together and decided to create a film about space and the mysteries that could lie beyond our planet.

     This is an extremely polarizing film, it's one of those movies that you love or you hate. It's widely considered to be one of the greatest films ever created, but many critics didn't receive it very well. It's very hard to say who will like it and who won't but I very strongly feel like everyone should see this film at least once in their lives. 

     It's one of the most influential films of all time, throughout the movie you'll be thinking "Oh wow they're doing that cliche? Oh wow they're gonna put that song there? That's so overdone" but no. The reason these things are cliche's is because they're referencing this movie.

I'm excited to see you all there! I can't say how much I'm looking forward to this weekend.
results.name: Movie Night: 2001: A Space Odyssey

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Meet Up Mary is a regular on the social circuit in New York.   You'd probably know her if you've been out before.  She was very personable, friendly and bubbly!  Unfortunately Mary met a horrific end at Grand Central and the police need you help to solve her case!  Join us for this fun and educational night where you will get to explore every corner of the NYC Landmark in ways that you never have before! (If you have participated in our other Grand Central Hunts no worries as this is a completely different experience)  You will learn, discover, uncover and socialize with other fun members of our group before during and after the hunt!  No experience is necessary!

How it works:

-Registration is at Lexington's Lounge from 6:30-7pm.  We will put you on teams if you don't already have one.

-Each team will be given a list of clues and 90 minutes to head to Grand Central to try and uncover the mystery of Mary's demise!

-The teams with the most points win!

-Once everyone is back we'll have a party where you can share your experiences with the others!

Cost: $10 ** MUST CLICK ON LINK BELOW TO PRE-PAY TO RESERVE YOUR SPOT https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-great-murder-mystery-at-grand-central-scavenger-hunt-tickets-24382725388

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own.

Dress code: business casual

How long does it last?  Everyone will be finished with the Hunt around 8:30pm.  You can hang for as long or little as you would like at that point.

Does Lexington's have food?  Yes they have an awesome small plates menu
results.name: The Great Murder Mystery at Grand Central Scavenger Hunt

results.description:
Congrats!  You are invited to Live Private  Concert  w Beautiful Music that will take you to that other place-

The Alacorde Piano Trio: Jee Sun Lee, violin,

Suji Kim, cello, and Jacqueline Schiller-Audi, piano, playing music by Turina, Gershwin, Piazzolla and Dumky. 

http://jeesunlee.com/audio.htm


http://jeesunlee.com/concert.htm

Violinist Jee Sun Lee performs throughout the US, Russia, Italy and Korea. This season, she made her Chicago Cultural Center debut on the Dame Myra Hess Concert Series and the recital was broadcast live on WFMT. 


 Sun Lee is an active chamber musician, having studied with the Grammy Award-winning Emerson String Quartet !

https://youtu.be/ot8GaM7m-Es

Their new CD will also be available for purchase. 

Doors open at 7:00 and the concert begins at 8:00 p.m. 

PREPAYMENT HERE

Advance tickets are $20 and can be purchased via PayPal on the Society Cafe website, <a>www.societycafeconcertseries.com.</a>

Tickets are $25 the night of the concert. 

The Society Cafe Concert Series offers a series of concerts of all musical genres and styles at the Unitarian Society of Ridgewood. 

Wine, dessert and coffee, provided by local vendors, are available before the shows and during intermission.

The Unitarian Society of Ridgewood is located at 113 Cottage Place, Ridgewood, NJ. 


Enjoy 

Robert

Start your Saturday night out right with Tabletop Game Night at the Brooklyn Strategist!  Starting at 8pm, we turn down the lights and reach for the top-shelf games.  Led by two of the most experienced Board Games Gurus in Brooklyn, we'll take you on a journey through the best modern board games around.  Whether you are merely curious about this rapidly expanding hobby or are a long time enthusiast tired of playing the same games with the same people, our experts will put your brain to work as you play through our extensive game library.  All levels of experience are welcome and encouraged to participate.

We play all genres of games, from intense strategy games to light, easy to pick up party games.


Past games include: 

Lords of Waterdeep, Concept, 7 Wonders, Pandemic, Citadels, Evolution, Bang!, Snake Oil, Acquire, Libertalia, Cuba.


Any attendees to the program will receive a special 10% discount on retail game sales!

venue.name: Peter Jay Sharp Theater at Symphony Space

results.description:
DANCING THE GODS FESTIVAL - 2 Nights 


World Music Institute's annual Dancing the Gods festival-which has "a record of attracting some truly godlike dancers" (The New York Times)-returns for its fifth season. This festival unites some of the world's most talented Indian classical dancers with live musicians for two spectacular nights of performances, lecture-demonstrations, and chat & chai artist receptions, bringing the audience closer to the artists. 

NIGHT ONE: Mythili Prakash: "JWALA - The Flame" - 8pm

Pre-show Lec-Dem with Festival co-curator Rajika Puri at 7pm

Chat & Chai meet and greet with the artists after the performance

Hailed a child prodigy, Mythili Prakash began her career at the age of eight and has performed extensively over the last two decades in prestigious venues and festivals throughout the world. She brings to this year’s *Dancing the Gods* festival a production exploring the multiple resonances of Jwala, the flame, as a symbol of life and spirit, both physical and metaphysical. Trained by her mother, Viji Prakash, in Bharata Natyam dance, she is now mentored by India’s acclaimed master Malavika Sarukkai. Mythili’s use of traditional Bharata Natyam technique and extended repertoire creates new structures that awaken the physicality, musicality, and theatricality of the art form. While highly acclaimed for her technical and virtuosic skill as a performer, Mythili stays deeply rooted in the inherent spirituality of the art form, which is the driving inspiration of both her choreographic explorations and her own practice.

Ticket Link - http://www.symphonyspace.org/event/9014/Dance/dancing-the-gods-festival for alternate tickets please visit: worldmusicinstitute.org

NIGHT TWO: Sanjukta Wagh: “Rage and Beyond: Irawati’s Gandhari” - 7pm

Pre-show Lec-Dem with Festival co-curator Rajika Puri at 6pm

Chat & Chai meet and greet with the artists after the performance

Performer, choreographer, teacher, and curator, Sanjukta Wagh has trained extensively under Rajashree Shirke in Kathak dance and Pandit Murli Manohar Shukla in Hindustani music. Her engagement with theatre (honed by playwright-director Chetan Datar), her work at the Laban Centre of Dance in London, her love of literature, and her deep unease with comfort zones have led to her interdisciplinary and exploratory mode of work.


This year’s Dancing the Gods festival features her most recent dance/theater work, Rage and Beyond: Irawati’s Gandhari. Inspired by Irawati Karve’s acclaimed text Yugant (which studies the characters of the epic Mahabharata) and interested in embodiment of the character Gandhari (an incarnation of the Goddess of Intelligence), the work won two National Theatre Awards at META (India) in 2015.


Ticket Link - http://www.symphonyspace.org/event/9014/Dance/dancing-the-gods-festival for alternate tickets please visit: worldmusicinstitute.org


https://youtu.be/yIKZun973iM

https://youtu.be/zuen5nw_d6w
results.name: Dancing The Gods Festival

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
